subsection.title: Expansions in Series of Whittaker Functions

para.sentence: For expansions of arbitrary functions in series of M_{\kappa,\mu}\left(z\right) functions see Schäfke (1961b).

subsection.title: Expansions in Series of Bessel Functions

para.sentence: For z\in\mathbb{C} , and again with the notation of §§10.2(ii) and 10.25(ii),

M_{\kappa,\mu}\left(z\right)=\Gamma\left(\kappa+\mu\right)2^{2\kappa+2\mu}z^{ \frac{1}{2}-\kappa}\*\sum_{s=0}^{\infty}(-1)^{s}\frac{{\left(2\kappa+2\mu \right)_{s}}{\left(2\kappa\right)_{s}}}{{\left(1+2\mu\right)_{s}}s!}\*\left( \kappa+\mu+s\right)I_{\kappa+\mu+s}\left(\tfrac{1}{2}z\right), if 2\mu,\kappa+\mu\neq-1,-2,-3,\dots, and \frac{1}{\Gamma\left(1+2\mu\right)}M_{\kappa,\mu}\left(z\right)=2^{2\mu}z^{\mu +\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{s=0}^{\infty}p_{s}^{(\mu)}(z)\left(2\sqrt{\kappa z}\right)^ {-2\mu-s}J_{2\mu+s}\left(2\sqrt{\kappa z}\right), where p_{0}^{(\mu)}(z)=1 , p_{1}^{(\mu)}(z)=\frac{1}{6}z^{2} , and higher polynomials p_{s}^{(\mu)}(z) are defined by \exp\left(-\tfrac{1}{2}z\left(\coth t-\frac{1}{t}\right)\right)\left(\frac{t}{ \sinh t}\right)^{1-2\mu}=\sum_{s=0}^{\infty}p_{s}^{(\mu)}(z)\left(-\frac{t}{z} \right)^{s}.
Additional expansions in terms of Bessel functions are given inLuke (1959).
For other series expansions seePrudnikov et al. (1990, §6.6).
